TITLES: Oh, for a thousand tongues, to sing
Great God, attend, while Zion sings
Come, let us join our cheerful songs
Lord, we come before thee now,
Lord, grant thy blessing here to-day;
Jesus, our Lord, make no delay
Before Jehovah’s awful throne,
How happy are our ears,
Stand up, and bless the Lord,
Holy and reverend is the name
Servants of God, in joyful lays,
Praise to Him by whose kind favor
How pleasant, how divinely fair,
Blow ye the trumpet, blow
Early, my God, without delay,
Thy presence, gracious God, afford;
Almighty Father, bless the word,
How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
O Thou, to whom, in ancient time,
O Bow thy ear, Eternal One!
Here, in thy name, Eternal God,
How beauteous are their feet,
==Come ye that love the Lord
What shall I render to my God
Come, sound his praise abroad,
I love the sacred book of God;
Holy Bible! book divine!
Let everlasting glories crown
Father of mercies, in thy word
’Twas by an order from the Lord
A glory in the word we find,
Thou book of life, in thee are found
==What is the chaff, the word of man,
Let others boast of wealth or power,
How perfect is thy word,
God, in the gospel of his Son,
Blessed Bible, how I love it!
How precious is the book divine,
With my whole heart I’ve sought thy face,
Thou art my portion, O my God!
Thy precepts often I survey;
Oh! that the Lord would guide my ways
Oh! that thy statutes every hour
THY law is perfect, Lord of light;
Blest are the undefiled in heart,
Thrice happy he who shuns the way
Bless’d be thy name, O Lord my God!
Come, ye that fear the Lord,
God’s holy law, transgressed,
Sweet is the work, my God, my King,
Delightful day! first gift of Heaven
Dear Lord, we would thy praises sing,
This is the day of sacred rest,
Awake, my heart! my soul arise!
Thine earthly Sabbaths, Lord, we love,
IN thy house while now we sing,
Truth is the gem for which we seek,
This day the Lord has called his own;
Lord of the Sabbath, hear us pray,
We’ve entered now on holy time,
Welcome, sweet day of rest,
Blest hour, when mortal man retires
When the worn spirit wants repose,
Come, dearest Lord, and feed thy sheep,
Thus far we’re spared again to meet
Safely through another week,
With joy we hail the sacred day
Again our earthly cares we leave,
THE God that made the earth,
Welcome, the Sabbath hour,
The light of Sabbath eve
Closing Sabbath! Ah, how soon,
The sun rolls down the distant west,
Welcome, welcome, day of rest,
Again the day returns of holy rest,
Hail, peaceful morn, thy dawn I hail,
Thine holy day’s returning,
Hail peaceful day! divinely blest!
How sweet to leave the world awhile,
O day of rest and gladness,
Another six days’ work is done,
Thy holy Sabbath, Lord,
Lord of the Sabbath and its light,
I Love thine earthly Sabbaths, Lord,
Ere to the world again we go,
Now is th’ accepted time,
Say, burdened soul, whose numerous sins
Sinner, art thou still secure?
Show pity, Lord; O Lord, forgive!
Come, weary souls, with sin distressed,
My Lord, my Lord, to thee I cry;
Beside the gospel pool,
Did Christ o’er sinners weep?
God of my life, to thee I call,
Come, humble sinner, in whose breast
Return, O wanderer, return,
Awaked from sin’s delusive sleep,
Jesus, my advocate above,
I seek the mercy-seat,
Father, I dare believe
O Sinner, mark thy fate!
Come hither, all ye weary souls;
Sinners, haste to mercy’s gate,
Heavy clouds are gathering fast,
To-day the Saviour calls!
Just as I am— without one plea,
’Tis the last call of mercy, that lingers for thee;
Approach, my soul, the mercy-seat,
With broken heart and contrite sigh,
Saviour, Prince, enthroned above,
Delay not, delay not; O sinner, draw near:
Oh! fo r a faith that w'ill not shrink,
Unshaken as the sacred hills,
Away my unbelieving fear!
GIVE to the winds thy fears,
By faith I to the fountain fly,
Arise, my soul, arise,
Kind are the words that Jesus speaks
How happy every child of grace,
I know that my Redeemer lives,
’Tis by the faith of joys to come,
’Tis faith that purifies the heart;
Ah, why should doubts and fears arise?
Morning breaks upon the tomb,
O Thou that hear’st the prayer of faith,
High in the heavens, Eternal God,
From deep distress and troubled thoughts,
Oh! could our thoughts and wishes fly,
With joy we meditate the grace
Oh, happy day that fixed my choice
Wait, O my soul, thy Maker’s will,
Ah! whither should I go,
In every trying hour
Buried beneath the yielding wave,
Down to the sacred wave,
Salem’s bright King, Jesus by name,
Buried with Christ! yes, thus we lie
’Tis down into the water
Here, Saviour, we would come,
Come, Holy Spirit, Dove divine,
Welcome, from beneath the wave
Baptized into our Saviour’s death,
Let plenteous grace descend on those
This rite our blest Redeemer gave
Come, sacred Dove, in peace descend,
Lord, meet us in this path of thine;
While in this sacred rite of thine,
With willing hearts we tread
Love divine, all love excelling,
Spirit Divine, attend our prayer,
COME, Holy Spirit, c om e;
Come, gracious Spirit, heavenly Dove,
Come, blessed Spirit, source of light,
Holy Spirit, light divine,
Holy Spirit, source of gladness,
O Thou that hearest prayer,
Holy Spirit! fount of blessing,
We are sinful: cleanse us, Lord;
Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,
Eternal Spirit, power of truth,
Let thy Spirit, blessed Saviour,
Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly guest,
Go, preach my gospel, saith the Lord;
Thy broken body, gracious Lord!
Sweet the moments, rich in blessing,
Coming Saviour, now in faith,
At thy command, O Lord, our hope,
Give me again to drink the cup,
There is a dear and hallowed spot
With Jesus in our midst,
’Twas on that dark, that doleful night,
He dies! the Friend of sinners dies!
O thou, my soul, forget no more
How dreadful was the curse that fell
Saviour of our ruined race,
A parting hymn we sing,
Jesus invites his saints
There is a fountain filled with blood
From the table now retiring,
My God, permit me not to be
Afflicted saint, to Christ draw near,
One precious boon, O Lord, I seek,
Soldier of Christ, arise,
Awake! Jerusalem, awake!
Am I a soldier of the cross,
God of love that hearest prayer,
Triumphant Zion, lift thy head
My blest Redeemer and my Lord,
Broad is the road that leads to death,
When I can read my title clear,
Dark was the night, and cold the ground
If, through unruffled seas,
The heavenly treasure now we have
OH, could I find, from day to day,
All praise to our redeeming Lord,
How sweet, how heavenly is the sight
For a season called to part,
Lo! what an entertaining sight
WHAT! never speak one evil word?
How blest the sacred tie that binds
Be perfect—holiness pursue;
Jesus, thine all-victorious love
EYE hath not seen, ear hath not heard,
When, my Saviour, shall I be
Lord, in the strength of grace,
Blessed Jesus, heavenly Lamb,
O Saviour, may we never rest,
Oh, for a heart to praise my God!
Come on, my partners in distress
When darkness gathers round thy way
How prone are professors to rest on their lees,
Jesus, at thy command,
The Christian warrior— see him stand.
Awake, my soul! stretch every nerve,
Toil on a little longer here,
’Tis my happiness below,
Let me but hear my Saviour say,
Shall I, for fear of feeble man,
Rejoice, believer, in the Lord,
Jesus, my strength, my hope,
Brethren, while we sojourn here,
Oh! speed thee, Christian, on thy way,
We are living, we are dwelling,
Prayer is appointed to convey
I want a principle within,
And are we yet alive,
